turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Where's Laurie?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I don't think she's coming with us.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: We're running, Rorschach.  We've got no place to go.  We're hightailing it down to Adrian's.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Veidt's assassin.  Leads to follow.  Can't just --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Cases, leads -- they don't matter, Rorschach.  The world's about to end.  If someone is trying to kill us, it doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Coward.  Giving up.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: SHUT UP, Rorschach.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Sorry, Daniel.  You've always been a good friend.  I know that.  Sorry about Laurie.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Okay, let's just . . . thank you.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: The guidance system's fried.  I had to switch to manual.  -- Some kind of massive electromagnetic shockwave.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: What caused it?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Don't know.  Nothing I can think of --  -- outside of a nuclear blast.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Adrian.  What are you doing?  Why wouldn't you let us in?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: He's the one.  He's been the one all along.  Stalking us.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Adrian -- you?  You killed Blake, and --

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: . . . And they call me a fucking nut.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Adrian.  ItÂ¹s too late.  The world is blowing up as we stand here.

turns.speaker: JON
turns.text: I'll say.  If we ever get off this looney-tune project, I'm gonna head straight for civilization and buy me a big thick steak.

turns.speaker: JANEY
turns.text: With lots of ketchup?

turns.speaker: JON
turns.text: Nothing wrong with ketchup.

turns.speaker: JANEY
turns.text: Jon Osterman, you don't act like a Princeton boy.  What's a big lug like you doing in a place like this?

turns.speaker: JON
turns.text: Anything for science, I guess.  Janey, there's something --

turns.speaker: JANEY
turns.text: We should get back --  What?

turns.speaker: JON
turns.text: Nothing.  What were you going to say?

turns.speaker: JANEY
turns.text: We should get back to the lab.  You okay, Jon?

turns.speaker: JANEY
turns.text: Stupid watch.  Stopped again.  Do you have the --

turns.speaker: JON
turns.text: Janey, will you marry me?

turns.speaker: JON
turns.text: I can fix it.

turns.speaker: JANEY
turns.text: -- What?

turns.speaker: JON
turns.text: My dad's a watchmaker.  I'll put it back together for you.  Better than ever.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Sphinx brand.  When I got out of weapons design, I wanted to move into a more . . . humanitarian area.  I was thinking: what would do some good in the world?  And I thought: why not a genetically-altered tobacco, that no only doesn't cause cancer -- but cleans out your lungs as you smoke it?  In fact I think I'll have one now.  Care to join me?

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Thanks, no.  But it's a wonderful product.  Now Adrian -- your old colleague Dr. Manhattan has just left the planet amid rumors --

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: No.  No.  Cut.  -- Justine, we agreed.  No questions about the Watchmen.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Oh sweetheart, just a quick one.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: No.  We laid out very careful ground rules --

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: No comment.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Did you know he was back on the streets?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I did not.  Now get out of my way!

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Isn't it true that you --

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: Their real names, please.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I don't know their real names.

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: You're lying, Miss Juspeczyk.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I don't know their real names!

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: You're not "protecting" anyone.  These people's lives may depend on the answers you give.  These are all former associates of Dr. Manhattan --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Then why don't you ask him?!?

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: Sit down, Miss Juspeczyk.  As I mentioned, the people in this file are all close associates of Dr. Manhattan.  They have something else in common as well.  They've all developed a fairly . . . exotic form of lymphatic cancer.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What are you saying?  That Jon is radioactive?

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: I'm terribly sorry.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What does this mean?  What does it --

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: Six to eight months.  That's with treatment.  -- Perhaps now you can see why it's so vital that we locate your . . . friends.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: That's it.  This is all a trick, isn't it?  Some kind of horrible joke to make me --

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: All right, Miss Juspeczyk.  Pack your things.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Am I free to go?

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: You're free to do whatever you goddamn well please.  Let's move it.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I don't know why you've been keeping me here, but you're in deep shit --

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: Oh, I am, honey.  You see, Russian tanks are crossing the Afghan border this very minute.  And we are all of us, every living soul, in deep, deep shit -- because our number-one strategic weapons has finally flipped out.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon??  You mean he's --

turns.speaker: SCHMIDT
turns.text: That's right.  Your meal ticket's flown the coop.  That blue bastard has apparently left the planet.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Adrian.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Laurie!  Good to see you.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Don't rub it in.  I live here.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: And how's life with the walking H-bomb?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: He's in by the superaccelerator.  -- Let me take your coat.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Adrian!  Don't leave so soon.  I --

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I'll take a raincheck, Laurie.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: He's a little farther gone every time.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Stay, Adrian.  I just -- every once in a while, I need to talk to someone human.  He doesn't think like we do.  He doesn't even feel what we feel.  I mean -- he even scares the research teams.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Laurie -- he's the most powerful man who's ever lived.  He's changed the world.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I know.  I shouldn't be saying this.  He's happy, he's content, he's doing his work --

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I suppose I'm serving my purpose, aren't I.  I'll ring for the guards.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Nasty cough.  -- Try one of mine.  Darling, you need to get out of the house.  Why don't you give Daniel a call?  I'm sure he'd be glad to hear from you.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Maybe I'll do that.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I'm sorry about Blake.

turns.speaker: MOLOCH
turns.text: I don't know who you are buddy, but I swear to God, you got the wrong guy.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Edgar William Jacobi, aka William Edgar Bright, a.k.a. Moloch.

turns.speaker: MOLOCH
turns.text: You're making a big --

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Terrorist.  Radical agitator.  Stool pigeon.

turns.speaker: MOLOCH
turns.text: ALL RIGHT!  ALL RIGHT!!  -- How'd you find me?

turns.speaker: MOLOCH
turns.text: Rorschach, you're talkin' heavy duty stuff.  I got nothing to do with --

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Worked both sides of the fence.  Ask your old buddies in the CTU.

turns.speaker: MOLOCH
turns.text: CTU?  Jesus.  You don't think --

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Don't know.  Ask around.  I'll be back.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Two things I hate.  Street mimes . . . users of recreational drugs.

turns.speaker: MOLOCH
turns.text: No, no.  You got it all wrong.  I been on the case, Rorschach, I got something for you.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: New information.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Ever see one of these before?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Too important for telephone.  Comedian -- Dr. Manhattan.  All linked up.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: What is that ungodly smell?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Bigger than I thought.  CTU involved . . .

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Yeah, I've heard all about your conspiracy theories.  Now I've got a roomful of cameras in there.  I want you out.  Now.  And whatever you're doing, knock it off.  You're making us all look bad.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Fate of the world at stake, Adrian.  Can't get too worked up over bad press.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Gila Flats -- place where Jon turned into . . .

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Dr. Manhattan, right.  Now if you boys care to join me, we'll go save the world.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Veidt.  You're the one who started World War III.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: No.  I just hastened the inevitable.  He's been ready to blow for years.  I knew all it would take was a little push.  So I, uh . . . gave his friends and associates cancer.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Call off the cat and I'll kill you, Veidt.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Before you do that, you might want to look at what I've been looking at.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: The name's Gibbons. You were saying?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Looks like a diner.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Diner, huh? Let me tell you what the problem is. I wake up drugged to find what? You've got a "salesman" over here reading a three week old newspaper. He's pulling a 211 with a "trucker", who happens to be packing a cop issue H&K 9mm. I get tipped that something is going down when she passes me a note. How's that for twisted logic? How did she know there was trouble unless they pulled the guns before I "walked" in? And if that's true, why'd they stop and wait until I woke up to gaffle the money? Then I notice how beefy they both are. Hell, even the waitress is cut. All three of them look like they went through the same training program. Ergo they ain't strangers and this isn't what it seems. That's how I knew yo-yo wouldn't get a round off even if I gave him all day. Why?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Most guys we ran through this either took off or helped them rob the place. I expected you to do the same.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: That shows me already that you don't have a clue. What's it to you, anyway?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Whether you thought this was for real or not, you jumped in and helped the waitress on instinct. That tells me something about your character.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Good for you. Now why don't you stop wasting my time and tell me what you want. You didn't go through all this for my benefit.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: It's your lucky day. You just might get the chance to pay back our wonderful country for all the freedom you enjoy.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: A Fed, I shoulda known. Who else would have this kind of budget? Now you're gonna hit me with the sales pitch.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Alright, Cage, you've got me. This is one of those moments. "Many are called, few are chosen", that kind of thing. Your government needs you. Are you up for the challenge?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: ..If you're trolling around for narcs, man, have you got the wrong guy.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Why is that?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Look at me, dude, do I look like a fan of law enforcement? Forget the tests, you shoulda just asked me. I woulda saved you a lot of trouble.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Oh I don't know, I think the tests work pretty well. Sometimes they give me answers you wouldn't admit to in a million years.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Are we done now? You've got nothing on me. So if you ain't booking me, I'm walking.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You've got this wrong. You're not under arrest, you've been abducted. And until I say different, you belong to me.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Is that a fact?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Sure as gravity. I've had a feeling about you from the start, Cage. It's nausea.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You know what I hate? Any scumbag with a clean shirt and a bad haircut can get one of those tin stars and suddenly they think they're God.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You know what I hate? It's always the assholes that pass the tests.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Congratulations, you've just graduated at the head of your class.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You're a cold piece of work. You almost got three people killed out there.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Good thing you were there to save the day. Come walk with me.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You've really got me confused, Cage. On the one hand you showed leadership, courage under fire, a willingness to protect men you hardly knew... and on the other you have an arrest record that pegs you as near sociopathic. Help me out here. I'm not following your evolution.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You want the cheap backstory? The runaway mom, the suicide dad and the foster homes? Gimme a break. You're not interested in my past, you're interested in my future as some kind of spy.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You're perceptive too. I forgot to add that to the list of surprises. I'm with the National Security Agency. And unlikely as it may sound, I need your help.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm not interested. I've already got a job.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You're an adrenaline junkie with one foot in the penitentiary. You risk your ass building a daredevil myth that means nothing and you're not getting any younger.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I plan on getting a lot older. And playing spy games sounds like a quick way to get yourself dead.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: That's too bad. I thought a guy like you would appreciate the challenge.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Now I'm the one who's nauseous. So what's the deal? What do you need me for?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: There's some folks I want to keep tabs on. Dirty, tattooed, uncivilized. Your kind of people.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What do I get out of it?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: If you find out what I want to know, and if I'm able to successfully use that information, you get to go back to your degenerate little life. If not, you take a bath.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You're one sick bastard. A sadist with a badge looking to rope me in to a suicide mission. I think no matter which way I go I'm likely to wind up face down on a sheet of plastic. So here's my answer: kiss my ass, Hop-along.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Not bad for a gimp.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: What's with that "X" on the back of your head? Does that mean you're "extreme"? I've got some news for you, Mr. X, you're a three time loser. So maybe you should tattoo another couple of X's on your head.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: How about a pedicure as long as you're down there. What's this? Lo-Jack?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Wherever you go on the planet, I'll find you. There's no quitting. If you try to take it off, a ring of needles will inject enough curare into your bloodstream to kill you before you hit the ground. Is all that clear?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Yeah, I spy or I die.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: I expect you to call in regularly with progress reports.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Fine, but I'm not gonna be no Bulldog Omega 5.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Up yours.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Crude and defiant as always, Triple X. It fits so well because you're obscene.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Is that all?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Just remember, I'll be watching.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I guess you got my E-mail. I set up a purchase. Ten cars.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: If you're trying to push my buttons, you're on the right track. Don't make me question my own judgment, X.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Buddy, you sent me here to get close to their organization, that costs money.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: One point two million dollars? I did not authorize you to spend one point two million dollars!

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm already on a first name basis with these dudes, I got a deal set up, you want me to hammer it or not?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: We're not after car thieves here.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What the hell am I after? You're telling me dick.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: That information is classified. You're there to gather information on their operations, period.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Call me crazy, but I thought hooking up a million dollar deal was a great way to get on their good side. What else? You gonna hassle me about the weapons and spy stuff too?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: My friend, if you're planning on crossing me...

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I know, poison needles in my shins. You've got 36 hours. Peace, out.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You did say "Ahab"? You're sure about that?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Yeah, I sent you pictures. Here's what I'm thinking. If they take out the cameras and sensors, they could probably put a bomb in this thing. You drop it in the water in the Red Sea and three weeks later it's swimming up the Potomac.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: This is good work, X, damn fine work. You need to press on at all costs, find out what they have planned with this "Ahab".

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Hey, one miracle at a time. They're on to me now, remember?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: I'm gonna be en route with a team shortly to relieve you. Just keep the pressure on until the cavalry arrives. And X? You done yourself proud helping those people today.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You're a grungy little phoenix, you know that? Keep up the good work.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You ain't seen nothing yet.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Snow covered fortress. Army of bad guys. The usual.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: I'm on the way with a team to relieve you. What's the latest?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: They retrofitted Ahab with some kind of rocket launcher. They were loading canisters of liquid into it, light colored and dark colored in the same tube but separate. Something tells me this it that "classified" stuff you didn't want me to know about. Does the song "Silent Night" mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Yes it does.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Come on, Gibbons, you can do better then that.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Silent Night is the name of a top secret binary nerve agent. The glass canister is shot into the air and detonated. The black and white chemicals mix, forming a toxic cloud. When it settles down to Earth, it'll kill everything in the vicinity.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Gibbons, this is something we came up with?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Yeah, that's right. So now that you know, you understand why it's important that we get it back.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Kinda funny, though, isn't it? We're not supposed to be making weapons like that anyway. Guess we shoulda played by the rules.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Somebody else makes those decisions, not guys like you and me. You've done your job, X, head back to Prague. I'll be landing in 90 minutes. This is my operation now.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We don't have that kinda time, boss, I don't think Prague's gonna be around much longer. I've gotta go now. I've got a lot of bad guys to kill.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Thought you bought the farm down there, X. Glad as hell to see you.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm pretty happy to see me too. So are you done with me yet?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You've kept up your end of the bargain, I'll do the same. But you really should consider staying on, you make a decent agent.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: But I hate cops, remember? Except for her.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Cut the crap, X, I saw you down there. You're a hero. Don't be afraid to join the good guys.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Who says you're the good guys?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You know what they say, the only way to change the system is from the inside.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Oh yeah? Why don't we start by taking this thing off my ankle? The poison needles?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: On come on, X. Did you really think we were that barbaric?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: No needles, huh? What about the acid bath?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: All for show. Just a psychological mind game to get you to do the right thing.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You're a jerk-off, you know that?

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: What do you have?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: Not a whole helluva lot. His final transmission was mangled. About something or someone called "Ahab". Whatever it is, it cost him his life.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: He was the best there was. That makes three agents lost.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: They're ruthless and they have a lot of firepower. It's only a matter of time before they figure out how to deploy Silent Night. Then we're gonna have a catastrophe on our hands.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: Silent Night in the hands of a bunch of impertinent cowboys

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: We're gonna have to step in, Sam. Those CIA boys couldn't find a clown in a field of cactus. Let me take care of it.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: How will you fix it?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: I'll go in with a team. But first I'm going to need some intel. I'll have to put someone inside, someone new, someone they won't see coming. One of their own.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: So you'll dredge the bottom again. You've done that before. The results were... uneven.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: You wanna find out about rats, ask a rat. I've had my people put together a talent pool. I downloaded it to your desktop.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: The usual prospects. Convicts, contract killers, murde...

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: The scum of the Earth.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: But programmable. And expendable.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: I've seen enough. Turn it off.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: They're degenerates. There's not a man in there that would give a damn if the Chinese took over.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: That's exactly why we need them.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: Ridiculous. Cut him off. I'm sorry Gibbons, you pulled up a shark this time.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: I think we should send him whatever he wants.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: You what? A wire transfer of this size?

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: If it means getting Silent Night back, absolutely.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: You're talking about a very expensive risk here.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: He's gotten closer in 24 hours than all of the other operatives combined. He got us an account number to boot. Now even if he's just dumb and lucky, I say we back his play.  I put him out there, Sam. If he doesn't come up with the money, they'll kill him. I can't let that happen.

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: Why not? You were going to throw him in a tub full of acid, weren't you?

turns.speaker: SAM TANNICK
turns.text: Alright, do what you want. But keep the screws on him. He's a wild card. That could be either good or bad.

turns.speaker: GIBBONS
turns.text: So the odds are up to fifty-fifty? I can deal with that.

turns.speaker: JEFE
turns.text: Whatchu doing here?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Oh, I don't know. It was an accident.

turns.speaker: JEFE
turns.text: That's some accident, hombre. You accidentally fall out of a plane in the middle of the night and land up in my back yard.

turns.speaker: JEFE
turns.text: We seen this kind of parachutes before, you know. U.S. Army. You got some friends here, jump out with you guys?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We're anti-social. We don't have any friends.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We're on to the game, ese. You got the fake blood splattered all over the walls, you got your torture tools... It's all very cute. But come on, let's quit while you're ahead. I'm only trying to save you a beatin'.

turns.speaker: JEFE
turns.text: You saving me? You talking pretty tough for a guy got himself chained to the ceiling.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Alright. You wanna eat through a tube, be my guest.

turns.speaker: JEFE
turns.text: Now you're gonna make me enjoy this, funny guy. Now I'm gonna take the whole foot off. Whatchu think of that?

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: What game is that?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Slick graphics, huh? See these dudes? They're called "Anarchy 99", they're the bad guy bosses.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: Do they have any special powers? The bosses always have special powers.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You wanna check it out? Come here.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Next we got a Siberian redneck, Viktor. Into snowmobiles and snowboarding. So naturally, he covers prostitution and the drug trade.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: Naturally.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: This guy's kinda dorky lookin'.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Kirill, the sniper. Looks like a bookworm, but he had 72 confirmed kills in Chechnya, they called him the "Finger of God". Assassination and weapons.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Yorgi masterminded the take-over of three Red Mafiya clans. Cops called it "blood week". He combined all of their global enterprises into one huge crime syndicate: Anarchy 99.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: "Anarchy" 99"?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What are you gonna do? They're Euro- trash.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: What weapons do you have?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Just about anything I want, it looks like. This is gonna be tough, though. There's no way to save this game. I gotta get it right the first time through.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: What do you get if you finish?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Nothing, really. My guy is just doing it to stay alive.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: Oh. I bet by the end he gets something out of it.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: He gets to be the hero.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Ten is hardly worth the effort. We're talking a lousy million five U.S.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I have Japanese buyers who are looking to move a fleet, if you have the quality of merchandise they're after. And it's a mil two, max.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Do you know what a wire transfer is?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Is she for real? Honey, maybe you should quiet down and let the grownups have a conversation.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: My goodness, a word with four syllables. I should get some ice before your brain gets too hot.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Sure. Just chisel some off your heart.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: So cute. He shows up for a battle of wits with a mental butter knife.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: If you got a problem with me, why are we dancing?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Yorgi asked me to.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You do everything Yorgi says?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Go to hell.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: It's gonna be like that, huh? You got all bent out of shape as soon as he started dancing with someone else. Why's that?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Mind your business.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Did you guys used to date? That's it, right? He broke your heart and you're still soft on him. That's funny, it don't seem to fit with a tough broad like you.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Why are you still hanging around? Your business is finished, you should go home.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I was invited. What's your story?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I don't know who you are or where you come from, but I don't like you. You ask too many questions.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Come on, don't front like that. You'll put a guy right off you.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Don't even bother, X man, I'm not your type.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: That right? Why's that?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We hung out last night, remember?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I also remember you drove your car here. Who are you really? Make no mistake, I will shoot you and not feel bad about it. Who are you working for?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Hey, take it easy. I'm just a dude trying to make a buck.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Bullshit. I see you look at everything, study everything, ask questions. I know exactly what you're doing. Empty your pockets.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You've got to relax, baby, you're paranoid.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Hey, you're good.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Maybe we should start again, yes? I know so little about you, except that you're not what you say you are.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: That makes two of us then, sweetheart, because I ain't buying your bullshit either. You're not like them, I can see it in your eyes. So you tell me, who's bullshitting who?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: The eyes don't lie. All this has gotten to you, hasn't it, Petra? You came in as Yorgi's girlfriend and you stayed because it was fun. Now you don't like it so much, but you're in so deep you can't get out anymore. Tell me if I'm wrong, Petra.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Go to hell!

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Look at you. You're helping run things now. You're a gangster. I bet that snuck up on you. You woke up one day and you were a criminal.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: What are you?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm an information gatherer. You wanna go somewhere and talk about it?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: That's how you eat? It's like a gerbil.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm from L.A.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: So why don't you tell me something about who you gather information for. They obviously have very deep pockets. Are you from a rival clan?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Let's just say I'm freelancing and leave it at that.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Whoever sent you knew what they were doing. You and Yorgi are practically twins. Two nihilistic fashion victims who make a lot of noise but don't say much.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Don't judge a comic book by it's cover.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: You agree with a lot of what he says, don't you.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I know where he's coming from. The only thing I really don't get is why he dumped you. Up until I found that out, I thought his judgment was pretty sound.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Don't even start. I'll be honest, I don't trust you. Bur lets pretend for a minute that what you say is true, that I want to leave. What can you do about it?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: The people I know want facts, the kinds of things an insider would know. They're interested in putting Anarchy 99 out of business.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: All I have to do is risk my life providing you with these facts.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We could work together. Then maybe we could both get the hell out of here. There's a beach in Bora Bora with my name on it.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: A beach named X? That I'd like to see.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: So there you have it. I guess you just have to ask yourself, how bad to you want out?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: They tell me you're an American agent.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: There's no more time for games. They made you. There's a sniper out front waiting to put a bullet in your eye. Tell me if it's true.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: It's a long story, but yeah, more or less.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Jesus Christ. You're going to have to go out the back. The data that you copied with your toy. Tomorrow, at six o'clock. Look it up. We're taking a trip. Be there at six and you'll have plenty to tell your people.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: If I go out the back, he'll know you've warned me.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: That's alright, I'll figure something out.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Not an option. Just get up slowly like everything's cool. Petra, trust me. You just hung yourself out to dry for me, I'm not gonna let you down.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I can't let this happen. I want you to go out the back. I'll make up some excuse.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: They'll kill you, you know they will. Besides, there is no back door. Keep smiling. Ready? Now.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: So what's the plan with this Ahab? Are they selling it or what?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: No, something worse. He says it's a surprise, but I know him. This is his masterpiece.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We've got to find out what it is. Can you handle that?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: There's something I didn't have time to tell you before.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I'm a agent as well. KGB. I've been undercover for over a year.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You're what? What the hell have you been doing?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I don't know. Eight months ago I stop hearing from my people. No explanation, just silence. So I stay and I wait like I was told. Soon I'm in so far, they'd kill me if I left. Now every day I get farther and farther away from what I was. I'm like you said, a criminal.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm busted up for you, but Jesus, what the hell are you doing? Those people almost drowned on that boat and you didn't lift a finger.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: No, I guess I've been no help at all to you.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Get your head back in the game. There are lives at stake here.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Of course. I'll do what I can. I have to go, before they notice.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: When can I see you again?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: You can't, it's too risky. I'm not much help anyway, remember?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What the hell are you doing? You could've killed me!

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I heard you talking. I could tell where you were in the room.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I don't know what's going on anymore. I thought I was square with that dude. Now everybody's switching sides like it's the WWF.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What are you doing with the Ivans?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I know which cops are good and which are bad. Come with me. Come on, right now.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: We're getting out of this place. We've done enough.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Wait a minute, whoa. We can't go now. What's Yorgi got planned with that nerve agent?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: It doesn't matter anymore, forget it.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Of course it matters. Hey, hold on!

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: What do we owe our governments? Yours kidnapped you, mine abandoned me.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Petra, this ain't about the people that sent us here, you know that.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: No, now it's about us. Let's do something for us before we both get killed. Don't you want to get to Bora Bora, Xander?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We can't leave now. We have to do something.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Why? You're the one who believes in nothing. Screw the world, or whatever you said.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: They left. To a fortress in the mountains.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: We'll have to go after them.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Aren't you afraid?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: A long time ago I learned how to put fear away in a little place in my head. Maybe that's my problem. If you don't feel fear you can do some amazing things, but you can also screw your life up in ways you can't imagine.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I must be healthy, then, because I'm scared to death. I guess I'd better get back to Yorgi.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You don't have to do that.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Yes, I do. You're right. I can't just let him go free. Besides, I can help you from the inside.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Aren't they gonna wonder were you've been?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I was supposed to wait for the cop to kill you and then kill the cop. They'll believe me.  I've been lying for so long, one more time won't hurt.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: When this is over, we're just gonna take off, the two of us. Take a vacation.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: What the hell are we doing? We're doing all this together, trusting each other, making plans, and we haven't even slept together yet.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Don't you see, X? For the betterment of humanity, he's going to start World War Three.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: He's a regular humanitarian. And all this time I thought he was just a tool.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Yorgi and Kirill.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Let me guess, they had a big white torpedo with them.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Did you do your homework?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: If they launch it, I know how to bring it back.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Let's do this.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Where's he headed?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: He owns a big industrial complex on the river. He'll launch it from there.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Where'd the damn truck go?!

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Go to the water, it's that way!

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Toadies right behind.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Let me.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: A piece of shrapnel hit me.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm sick of that guy. Let's stop playing nice.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: He's shut out the communication circuit!

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You can't talk to it?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: No, it's like a safety. We are going to have to access the manual controls.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: A manual control on a moving torpedo. This day keeps getting better and better.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: It's running three meters down. Twenty knots.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: It has to surface to release the nerve agent, right?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: By then it's too late! The only way to safely dispose of the nerve agent is in deep water! The chemicals will break down and dissipate!

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Use your grenades! Maybe we can blow it up underwater!

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I can't believe my mission is finally over. I don't even know what to do with myself.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You can't welch on me now. We had a deal.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: It's about your next mission. You need to be debriefed.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Nothing. He had two days.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Perhaps he is not all he says he is.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: It all happened so fast. Such an unfortunate accident.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: What was that for?

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: I'd forgotten how exciting it is working together.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: You've been so quiet lately, Petra, I thought you no longer cared.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: Why don't we go below decks and work off some of this adrenaline.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Viktor! Stay the course.

turns.speaker: PETRA
turns.text: The Peace conference...

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Nice place to start, don't you think?

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: Hate those Russkie choppers. Rattle- trap pieces of garbage. I'm agent Shavers. Toby Lee Shavers. I'm looking for what's his name. Three X' s.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: That's would be me.

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: Back off, just go away you klutz. Alright, here's the story. The items in these cases belong to me. I designed them, built them, and was going to use them in the field myself until you showed up.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I stole your beat, huh? Guess you forgot to brown-nose the right people.

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: Is that supposed to be funny? I'm not laughing. I've worked for ten years to get my shot at being a field agent, funny boy. And ar the last minute I get bumped by you, some reject from the Ozzfest.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Why don't you show me some gear before you get hurt.

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: Listen to you. Right away, sir, anything you say, sir.

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: Miniature power cams set in on contact, giving you a sure grip on any surface.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: They come in any other styles or colors?

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: This is your standard dart gun.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: That one I'm real familiar with.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I think I'll hang on to these.

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: Think again, that's government property. You have to sign for everything. I've got one more that wasn't on your list.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: From the Beastie Boys collection?

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: It's a stakeout suit. It's got food, water, recording gear, anything you need for covert spying. It's all- weather, fire retardant, and if you give this buckle a sharp pull, the whole outfit deploys into a parachute.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You're joking, right?

turns.speaker: SHAVERS
turns.text: Now that I've given you the overview, we're going to spend the next couple hours going into extensive operational detail.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I thought that was in detail.
